item.title: 'Complete and total ceasefire': Trump announces end of Israel-Iran conflict;
item.description: Donald Trump announced a complete ceasefire agreement between Israel and Iran, claiming a 12-day war would end imminently. According to Trump, the ceasefire would be phased in, with Iran halting hostilities first, followed by Israel. However, neither Israel nor Iran has confirmed the agreement, despite a recent escalation of conflict involving airstrikes and missile attacks.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Thank you, Mr. President': Israel thanks Donald Trump with a huge banner - Middle East tensions
item.description: Tensions escalate as a massive banner praising President Trump appears in Tel Aviv following US airstrikes on Iranian nuclear sites. The Israeli Prime Minister lauded Trump's decision, while Iran vowed retaliation after retaliatory strikes. The Iranian ambassador condemned the attacks as an act of aggression at a UN meeting, reserving Iran's right to self-defense.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Iran-Israel conflict: Qatar closes airspace; Iran fires missiles targeting US air base in Al Udeid
item.description: Qatar temporarily suspended air traffic as a precautionary measure due to regional developments, with explosions heard shortly after. Iran affirmed launching an attack targeting US forces at Al Udeid air base in Qatar, which houses the US Central Command's forward headquarters. Bahrain also shifted some employees to telework as a precaution.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump joins Iran war: US bombs nuke sites-But did the Ayatollah just win?
item.description: American B-2 bombers attacked Iranian nuclear facilities at Fordo, Natanz, and Isfahan. Donald Trump claimed complete obliteration of Iran's nuclear infrastructure. Israel followed with strikes on missile sites. The attack strengthened the Iranian regime. It reignited anti-American sentiment. Experts fear Iran may accelerate its pursuit of nuclear weapons. Global oil prices surged amid wider conflict fears.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US strikes Iran: Who is 'Putin's brain' Aleksandr Dugin? And why is he angry at Donald Trump?
item.description: Alexander Dugin isnâ€™t a regular pundit. Heâ€™s more Rasputin than Kissingerâ€”equal parts political theorist, mystic nationalist, and civilisational evangelist. Born in the Soviet Union in 1962, Dugin came of age as Marxism faded and began crafting his own blend of geopolitics and esoterica. His 1997 magnum opus, Foundations of Geopolitics, proposed that Russia should dominate Eurasia, undermine the West, and forge an anti-liberal world order.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: What would happen to UAE and global energy markets if Iran closed the Strait of Hormuz?
item.description: Tensions between Iran and Israel have renewed fears of a closure of the Strait of Hormuz, a vital energy artery for global oil and LNG trade. A blockade could trigger soaring prices, disrupt global supply chains, and spark inflation. While Gulf nations and global reserves offer some buffer, prolonged disruption would strain economies worldwide and heighten geopolitical and market instability.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Israel-Iran conflict escalates: US warns of rising threats; New York, Washington, LA on high alert
item.description: The US State Department issued a "worldwide caution" for Americans on Sunday, saying the conflict in the Middle East could put those traveling or living abroad at an increased security risk. "The Department of State advises US citizens worldwide to exercise increased caution."
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: How India defied US and went nuclear
item.description: The truth is that politicians of various vintages played a part, irrespective of their worldview or political leanings. Every one of them was of the opinion that the Ayatollahs of Potomac (a delightful term coined by TOI legend K Subrahmanyam, the father of the current external affairs minister) couldnâ€™t be the only ones with the power of the sun in the palm of their hands.
item.dc:creator: Nirmalya Dutta

item.title: Georgian opposition leader jailed amid crackdown
item.description: A court in Georgia on Monday sentenced a prominent opposition leader to eight months in prison, in the latest case critics say is part of a mounting crackdown on dissent. Mamuka Khazaradze, leader of the opposition Lelo party and a staunch government critic, was sentenced by a Tbilisi court to eight months in prison and barred from holding public office for two years.

item.title: Watch: Rishi Sunak explains how following Dharma helped him become first Hindu UK PM
item.description: It was not just an abstract idea. Sunak revealed that Dharma was the principle that guided his decision to step into the chaos of British politics in 2022â€”after losing the Conservative Party leadership race, only to return weeks later as Prime Minister following Liz Trussâ€™s resignation and a market meltdown.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
